description: Nicholas G. Harring, 30, of 513 W. Third St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty to possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and placed on probation for 30 days. Harring was charged by Kulpmont Police Chief Nathan Foust in connection with a Feb. 28 incident on Route 61 near the Coal Township line. Tyler M. Snyder, 18, of 254 W. Saylor St.,...
text:
MOUNT CARMEL - Four defendants entered guilty pleas Wednesday and were ordered
by Magisterial District Judge William Cole to pay fines and costs.

Nicholas G. Harring, 30, of 513 W. Third St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty to
possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus
costs and placed on probation for 30 days.

A charge of possessing drug paraphernalia was withdrawn.

Harring was charged by Kulpmont Police Chief Nathan Foust in connection with a
Feb. 28 incident on Route 61 near the Coal Township line.

Tyler M. Snyder, 18, of 254 W. Saylor St., Atlas, pleaded guilty to possessing
a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and
placed on probation for 30 days.

A charge of possessing drug paraphernalia was withdrawn.

Snyder was charged by Mount Carmel Township Patrolman Brian Carnuccio relating
to a Jan. 8 incident at Mount Carmel Area High School.

Robert T. Delaney III, 51, of 452 W. Fourth St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty
to possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine
plus costs and placed on probation for 30 days.

Charges of criminal conspiracy and possessing drug paraphernalia were
withdrawn.

Delaney was charged by Mount Carmel Patrolman Evan Freiler in connection with
a Feb. 17 incident at his residence.

Jennifer F. Garzelli, 23, of 428 W. Second St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty
to a misdemeanor of disorderly conduct and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus
costs and placed on probation for one year.

A summary count of disorderly conduct and charges of simple assault and
harassment were withdrawn.

Garzelli was charged by Freiler relating to a May 26 disturbance at her home.

title: District Court: Guilty Pleas
html:
MOUNT CARMEL - Four defendants entered guilty pleas Wednesday and were ordered by Magisterial District Judge William Cole to pay fines and costs.

Nicholas G. Harring, 30, of 513 W. Third St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty to possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and placed on probation for 30 days.

A charge of possessing drug paraphernalia was withdrawn.

Harring was charged by Kulpmont Police Chief Nathan Foust in connection with a Feb. 28 incident on Route 61 near the Coal Township line.

Tyler M. Snyder, 18, of 254 W. Saylor St., Atlas, pleaded guilty to possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and placed on probation for 30 days.

A charge of possessing drug paraphernalia was withdrawn.

Snyder was charged by Mount Carmel Township Patrolman Brian Carnuccio relating to a Jan. 8 incident at Mount Carmel Area High School.

Robert T. Delaney III, 51, of 452 W. Fourth St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty to possessing a small amount of marijuana and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and placed on probation for 30 days.

Charges of criminal conspiracy and possessing drug paraphernalia were withdrawn.

Delaney was charged by Mount Carmel Patrolman Evan Freiler in connection with a Feb. 17 incident at his residence.

Jennifer F. Garzelli, 23, of 428 W. Second St., Mount Carmel, pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor of disorderly conduct and was ordered to pay a $500 fine plus costs and placed on probation for one year.

A summary count of disorderly conduct and charges of simple assault and harassment were withdrawn.

Garzelli was charged by Freiler relating to a May 26 disturbance at her home.
